image.altText: Two men outside a court house.

props.synopsis: Two alleged West Australian gold thieves have walked free with all charges against them dismissed, following a police forensics bungle which a defence lawyer argued would have "undermined public confidence in the justice system".

title.children: Alleged gold thieves walk free, awarded more than $22K in costs as forensics bungle sees trial abandoned

image.altText: Saline drip

props.synopsis: A shortage of IV fluids will last until at least the end of this year, as health ministers agree to meet weekly on the issue while critical supply constraints remain.

title.children: IV fluid shortage will remain for the rest of 2024, but health ministers urge calm

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile wading into a river, with the sandy bank in the background.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's north-west coast has seen more confirmed saltwater crocodile sightings in 2024 alone than in the past decade combined.

title.children: Crocodile numbers on the rise along the Pilbara coast

image.altText: Red earth of the Yalgoo townsite from above

props.synopsis: The tragedy has renewed pressure for an emergency rescue helicopter to be based in Geraldton after an RFDS aircraft had to be sent from Jandakot to the scene.

title.children: Renewed calls for Midwest rescue helicopter after triple fatal road crash

image.altText: A middle-aged Sri Lankan woman in glasses speaks into a microphone, with a sign reading 'Sri Lanka'

props.synopsis: A former Sri Lankan deputy high commissioner based in Australia has been ordered to pay more than $500,000 in unpaid wages to a domestic worker, who worked seven days a week for three years, with only two days off.

title.children: This boss paid her worker about 65 cents an hour. Now she is facing the consequences

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds a press conference with New Zealand prime minister Christopher Luxon.

props.synopsis: The Prime Minister says Australia and New Zealand have agreed to disagree over the fraught issue of criminal deportations after sitting down with Christopher Luxon for high level talks today in Canberra.

title.children: Australia and NZ agree to disagree on criminal deportations, Anthony Albanese says

image.altText: A view from above of a city on the coast with a shipping port

props.synopsis: Haifa lives with the vivid memory of being hit with rockets. It's taking unique steps to keep safe.

title.children: Burrowing underground — the world's largest fortified hospital lying in wait if Hezbollah attacks Israel

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks into a microphone while gesturing with both hands.

props.synopsis: As Kamala Harris pulls ahead of the former president in the polls, an increasing number of Republicans are urging their nominee to change tack or risk losing in November.

title.children: Republicans are warning Donald Trump to dial down the personal attacks. Here's why he's refusing

image.altText: AI influencer Margot Monet, pictured in a graphic image.

props.synopsis: As people spend more time online, bonds forged with influencers generated by artificial intelligence are rising. But experts warn the phenomenon could also be fuelling harmful behaviours in the darker corners of the internet.

title.children: Margot Monet's creators hoped she would rake in thousands as an AI influencer. The truth was more frightening

image.altText: Four people in formal clothes walking on street

props.synopsis: The brother of Senator Linda Reynolds tells a court it was difficult finding his sister very unwell and "rolled up in a ball" on a couch over allegations about how she treated Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Former defence minister found 'rolled up in a ball' on couch over Brittany Higgins allegations, court told

image.altText: Home and Away actor Orpheus Pledger wears a hoodie and has a neutral expression as he arrives at court

props.synopsis: Former Home and Away star Orpheus Pledger has been jailed for assault, with a magistrate telling him society is "fed up" with men attacking women.

title.children: Actor Orpheus Pledger jailed for seven months over drug-fuelled attack on woman

image.altText: A bright Milky Way under the silhouette of Uluru

props.synopsis: The votes are in and Australia has crowned the most amazing night sky experience. Here's everything you need to know about the Milky Way and how best to see it.

title.children: Nothing beats the Milky Way. Australia's favourite night sky feature revealed

image.altText: A woman wearing a green and gold tracksuit holds her hands like a kangaroo on a purple stage with judges behind her

props.synopsis: Australian Olympic breakdancer Rachael Gunn has asked for the "hate" towards her family and friends to stop in the aftermath of a media furore over her performance in Paris.

title.children: Breaker Raygun calls for end to 'pretty devastating' Olympics reaction

image.altText: Zali Steggall speaks in the House of Representatives surrounded by Labor women

props.synopsis: The OG teal independent has always had an ability to get under the skin of the blokes in the Coalition, but Thursday seemed different, with Steggall at times having to shout to get over the wall of words.

title.children: As Dutton joined the hecklers, a moment of kindness stopped business as usual in Parliament

image.altText: Girls in school uniforms write messages on a piece of cardboard affixed to a stone wall.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of mourners have gathered on the Gold Coast to remember Sophie Wang in the wake of her alleged murder this week.

title.children: 'Fly high, sweet angel': Schoolmates gather to mourn Sophie Wang

image.altText: A sad woman in a pink dress

props.synopsis: Alannah Lewis-Stafford hasn't lived in her wreckage of a home for two years, but her water company has continued to send her bills.

title.children: Alannah's home was destroyed, but her water company refused to stop charging her

image.altText: Side profile of a bald judge sitting in court

props.synopsis: The girl's mother, Latoreya Till, described Judge Kenneth King as a "big bully" after the incident.

title.children: US Judge sidelined for handcuffing teen who fell asleep in court on field trip

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: Five people, including Matthew Perry's personal assistant and an alleged Hollywood drug dealer dubbed the "Ketamine Queen", are arrested and charged in relation to the death of the Friends star.

title.children: Matthew Perry's assistant, two doctors and alleged 'street dealers' charged over his death

image.altText: A woman sitting tight lipped in front of a microphone.

props.synopsis: RBA governor Michele Bullock has doubled down on previous comments that interest rate cuts are unlikely in the near term at a parliamentary hearing in Canberra, while Australian shares are trading higher after a surge on Wall Street. Follow live.

title.children: RBA governor reiterates rate cuts unlikely in the near term at parliamentary hearing, ASX higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: NAB says more of its customers are falling behind on their home loans
ASX results released as ASA calls for chair to step down
Will the ASX break through the 8,000 mark again?

image.altText: a man aged 38 with three young children

props.synopsis: Dale Pantic's family are still searching for answers about how their missing father died as his killer Sam Gordon Blake is sentenced over his death following an 11th-hour guilty plea to manslaughter.

title.children: Father of five's body missing as killer gets nine years for manslaughter

image.altText: Jasveen Sangha wearing a GUCCI t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A woman dubbed the "Ketamine Queen" by authorities is one of five people charged in relation to Matthew Perry's overdose death. Here's what what we know about Jasveen Sangha.

title.children: Who is the accused 'Ketamine Queen' charged over Matthew Perry's overdose death?

image.altText: A composite image of six books for young readers, including illustrated picture books, and the gold Book of the Year sticker.

props.synopsis: The winners of the Children's Book Council of Australia's 2024 Book of the Year Awards have been announced, including debut author Karen Comer and author of 19 books Tristan Bancks.

title.children: 'It's never been so difficult to get a book into kids' hands': The book prize reaching young people

image.altText: Picture of a smart meter in the meter box

props.synopsis: Like millions of Australians, Doreen Fawcett is grappling with a nightmare of unwanted power bill complexity. Calls for simplification are growing.

title.children: 'That tariff should be outlawed': Why Australians are struggling to decipher some 'smart' meter charges

image.altText: A group of people stand with suitcases.

props.synopsis: Trips to Indonesia are outpacing trips to New Zealand "four to one" according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: International travel has rebounded to pre-COVID levels. Here are the most popular destinations

image.altText: Jordan Chiles pictured with her bronze medal

props.synopsis: Jordan Chiles is still hopeful about the eventual return of the individual bronze medal she won at the Paris Olympics before being stripped of it for a procedural rule violation.

title.children: Heartbroken US gymnast Chiles not giving up on bronze medal

image.altText: An image of a yellow solar powered sign at road works site

props.synopsis: Queensland Police allege they've uncovered a scheme where unsuspecting victims of identity theft were used to take the blame for hundreds of speeding offences.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly using stolen IDs to take blame for more than $140,000 in speeding fines

image.altText: Three soldiers wearing Ukranian military gear pose with guns next to vehicle

props.synopsis: "General Syrskyi reported the successful liberation of the city of Sudzha from Russian forces," President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

title.children: Ukraine says they have full control of Russian town Sudzha as advance continues

image.altText: A woman in a sparkling leotard sings and looks on.

props.synopsis: Pop megastar Taylor Swift returns to the stage in London for her first public performances since three shows in Vienna were cancelled after authorities uncovered a terrorist plot to "kill as many people as possible" at them.

title.children: 'I'm not worried at all': Fans unfazed by foiled terror plot as Taylor Swift resumes touring

image.altText: AR Rahman, in black sunglasses and a sparkly black jacket on stage holding a microphone

props.synopsis: In an Australian exclusive, we sit down with the renowned and beloved Tamil composer to talk about the power of music, technology and art, and his latest film, coming to the Indian Film Festival in Melbourne.

title.children: From Slumdog Millionaire to 127 Hours, we sit down with the composer of more than 145 film soundtracks

image.altText: A dog in a vet clinic.

props.synopsis: The veterinary sector is feeling the brunt of an IV fluid shortage, with animals at risk of missing out on life-saving operations. The dwindling supply has also seen prices skyrocket.

title.children: Vets fear IV fluid shortage 'could lead to deaths' as supplies are rationed

image.altText: A family of six and an aquarium guide stand looking through the glass at a diver, coral and tropical fish

props.synopsis: The country's largest living coral aquarium and national centre of reef education has been thrown a lifeline with the reallocation of $100 million in federal funding.

title.children: Australia's national reef education centre thrown $100 million lifeline by 'annoyed' council

image.altText: Man and woman standing behind a cart full of food and household items

props.synopsis: The media — and the internet in particular — are full of eye-catching bravado about the economy and what recent data is telling us about the future. But what happens when things are far from certain?

title.children: 'Winners and losers, gurus and charlatans, geniuses and buffoons': The real danger the RBA sees is overconfidence

image.altText: A one-legged man on a surfboard gets shacked on a glassy wave.

props.synopsis: Past and present world champions including Kelly Slater are pushing for event organisers to reconsider the decision not to include adaptive – or para – surfing at the next Paralympic Games.

title.children: 'Real bummer': Para surfers push to overturn decision not to include sport at LA Games
